intro: Agalinis navasotensis, commonly known as Navasota blazingstar, is a flowering plant native to the central United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its tall, erect stems and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and rocky slopes. It produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Agalinis navasotensis is often found in association with other native wildflowers in its ecosystem.
